Key Features.name: Centralized Management
Key Features.description: Make yourself the owner of any number of different accounts

Key Features.name: Consolidated Billing
Key Features.description: Duh.  Easily pay for all the accounts in one place

Key Features.name: Hierarchical Grouping/Organizational Units
Key Features.description: Put accounts in organizational units (OUs) to easily apply necessary rules, and then put those OUs in a heirarchy to pass rules from parents to children.

Key Features.name: Implement further usage restrictions (Service Control Policies)
Key Features.description: Create a Service Control Policy to limit what accounts can do.  For instance, block AWS services that don't meet regulatory requirements, keep users out of billing, etc...

Key Features.name: Better Tagging
Key Features.description: You can create tag policies across your accounts to enforce things even as simple as case conventions.

Key Features.name: IAM
Key Features.description: Override IAM policies to block more things

Key Features.name: Integration with other services
Key Features.description: Some services play nicely with AWS Organization and can be used to perform actions in your other accounts on your behalf
